turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Carpathian Flysch Belt.
turn.1: What is known about the Carpathians?
turn.2: Carpathian Flysch Belt The Carpathian Flysch Belt is an arcuate tectonic zone included in the megastructural elevation of the Carpathians on the external periphery of the mountain chain.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Geomorphologically it is a portion of Outer Carpathians. Geologically it is a thin-skinned thrust belt or accretionary wedge, formed by rootles nappes consisting of so-called flysch - alternating marine deposits of claystones, shales and sandstones which were detached from their substratum and moved tens of kilometers to the north (generally).
turn.5: Is there anything else that is known about the belt?
turn.6: The Flysch Belt is together with Neogene volcanic complexes only tectonic zone occurring along the whole Carpathian arc.
turn.7: What countries does the belt go through?
turn.8: The Carpathian Flysch Belt is connected to the flysch belt of the Alps (Rhenodanubian Flysch) and continues through the territory of the Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland, Ukraine and Romania.
turn.10: The belt is about 1,300 km long and 60 – 75 km wide.
turn.12: Sequences of the Flysch belt are thrusted over the margin of Carpathian foredeep in the north.
